name: getCallBroadcast
description: Returns a single CallBroadcast instance for a given call broadcast campaign id

fields.description: Limit fields received in response. E.g. fields: id, name or fields items (id, name), see more at [partial response](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#partial-response) page.

$block: Call broadcast can be used to send out a voice message to a group of numbers. It supports IVR scripting, scheduling, retry logic, playing pre-recorded sounds, answering machine detection

$ul: **answeringMachineConfig**: Specifies which action should be taken if answering machine was detected, default value: AM_AND_LIVE. Available values: AM_ONLY - run AMD (Answering Machine Detection), hang up if LA (Live Answer); AM_AND_LIVE - run AMD, play separate live vs. machine sound; LIVE_WITH_AMD, run AMD, hang up if machine answers; LIVE_IMMEDIATE - no AMD, play live sound immediately
**dialplanXml**: IVR xml is a document which describes the dialplan to setup the IVR broadcast
**fromNumber**: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) or short code for text. Example: 12132000384, 67076
**id**: A unique id of broadcast (readonly)
**labels**: Labels of a broadcast
**lastModified**: The time when a given resource was updated, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT
**localTimeRestriction**: Represents a range of time during which CallFire will send a call or text to recipients. Timeframe uses the local timezone of recipient's number
**beginHour**: An hour of restriction start
**beginMinute**: The minutes to start a restriction
**enabled**: A restriction enabled
**endHour**: An hour of restriction end
**endMinute**: The minutes of restriction end
**maxActive**: Sets a maximum number of calls to be dialed by CallFire at once
**maxActiveTransfers**: A maximum number of active transfers
**name**: A name of a broadcast
**recipients**: Recipients of a call broadcast, can be either existing contacts or a new ones
**resumeNextDay**: If true resumes the unfinished campaign to the next day
**retryConfig**: Retry configuration will help you to resend a call or text if it was not delivered first time
**maxAttempts**: Maximum number of retry attempts. Default value: 1
**minutesBetweenAttempts**: A number of minutes between retry attempts. Default value: 60
**retryPhoneTypes**: A list of phone number types to retry. Available values: FIRST_NUMBER, HOME_PHONE, WORK_PHONE, MOBILE_PHONE

**retryResults**: List of result states when a call/text should be addressed to this contact again. Supports any combination of result statuses. Available values: LA, BUSY, AM, NO_ANS, SENT, RECEIVED, etc. See [call/text states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)
**schedules**: A list of schedule objects which specifies a range of time when broadcast should be started and stopped. Supports the scheduling per day of week

**sounds**: A set of sounds assigned to a voice broadcast to play according to an answering machine configuration. You can add the existing sounds from the account's sound library or to provide a text which will be converted into a speech. There are four sound options available for a Voice Broadcast campaign
**dncDigit**: Digit pressed to place contact in DNC list
**dncSoundId**: An id of sound file to play when recipient decided to opt out and pressed DNC digit
**dncSoundText**: Text to be turned into sound, plays to notify that Do Not Call digit has been pressed and inform your contact of their placement on the Do Not Call list
**dncSoundTextVoice**: The voice to be used (MALE1, FEMALE1, FEMALE2, SPANISH1, FRENCHCANADIAN1)
**liveSoundId**: An id of sound file to play if phone is answered
**liveSoundText**: Text to be used to turned into a sound. This text will be played when the phone is answered
**liveSoundTextVoice**: The voice to be used (MALE1, FEMALE1, FEMALE2, SPANISH1, FRENCHCANADIAN1) for a live sound
**machineSoundId**: An id of a sound file to play if answering machine is detected
**machineSoundText**: Text to be turned into a sound. This text will be played when answering machine is detected
**machineSoundTextVoice**: The voice to be used (MALE1, FEMALE1 , FEMALE2, SPANISH1, FRENCHCANADIAN1) for a machine sound
**transferDigit**: Digit pressed to initiate a transfer
**transferNumber**: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) to transfer call to.  Example: 12132000384, 67076
**transferSoundId**: An id of a file to play if call is transferred
**transferSoundText**: Text to be turned into a sound. This text will be played when the transfer digit is played
**transferSoundTextVoice**: The voice to be used (MALE1, FEMALE1, FEMALE2, SPANISH1, FRENCHCANADIAN1) for a sound transfer

**status**: A status of a broadcast (read only). SETUP - campaign isn't configured yet; START_PENDING - waiting for contact batch population; RUNNING - campaign is running; STOPPED - campaign is stopped; FINISHED - campaign is finished; ARCHIVED - campaign was archived
